      49             : /**
      50             :  * mozilla::SelectionState
      51             :  *
      52             :  * Class for recording selection info.  Stores selection as collection of
      53             :  * { {startnode, startoffset} , {endnode, endoffset} } tuples.  Can't store
      54             :  * ranges since dom gravity will possibly change the ranges.

     103             :   nsresult RegisterSelectionState(SelectionState& aSelState);
     104             :   nsresult DropSelectionState(SelectionState& aSelState);
     105             : 
     106             :   // editor selection gravity routines.  Note that we can't always depend on
     107             :   // DOM Range gravity to do what we want to the "real" selection.  For instance,
     108             :   // if you move a node, that corresponds to deleting it and reinserting it.
     109             :   // DOM Range gravity will promote the selection out of the node on deletion,
     110             :   // which is not what you want if you know you are reinserting it.
     111             :   nsresult SelAdjCreateNode(nsINode* aParent, int32_t aPosition);
     112             :   nsresult SelAdjCreateNode(nsIDOMNode* aParent, int32_t aPosition);
     113             :   nsresult SelAdjInsertNode(nsINode* aParent, int32_t aPosition);
     114             :   nsresult SelAdjInsertNode(nsIDOMNode* aParent, int32_t aPosition);
     115             :   void SelAdjDeleteNode(nsINode* aNode);
     116             :   void SelAdjDeleteNode(nsIDOMNode* aNode);
     117             :   nsresult SelAdjSplitNode(nsIContent& aOldRightNode, int32_t aOffset,
     118             :                            nsIContent* aNewLeftNode);
     119             :   nsresult SelAdjJoinNodes(nsINode& aLeftNode,
     120             :                            nsINode& aRightNode,
     121             :                            nsINode& aParent,
     122             :                            int32_t aOffset,
     123             :                            int32_t aOldLeftNodeLength);

     125             :                         const nsAString &aString);
     126             :   nsresult SelAdjDeleteText(nsIContent* aTextNode, int32_t aOffset,
     127             :                             int32_t aLength);
     128             :   nsresult SelAdjDeleteText(nsIDOMCharacterData* aTextNode,
     129             :                             int32_t aOffset, int32_t aLength);
     130             :   // the following gravity routines need will/did sandwiches, because the other
     131             :   // gravity routines will be called inside of these sandwiches, but should be
     132             :   // ignored.
     133             :   nsresult WillReplaceContainer();
     134             :   nsresult DidReplaceContainer(dom::Element* aOriginalNode,
